title: What is left of the British Empire today? - Quora

response.answer_text: Gibraltar, and a few isolated islands. Every populated area of the former British Empire was offered its independence and strongly encouraged to take it, but some chose to continue to be British. Today’s Empire is very hands-off and largely ceremonial - all these territories have their own governments, except Antarctica, which doesn’t have a permanent population.

The former empire as noted by the other writers does not exist. There are cultural, political, and trade ties in a Commonwealth organization. Some ex-colonies maintain some weird political arrangements that technically prevent them from being republics. Like the US there are also some territories with weird legal status but the people who live there are British by identity, as they keep affirming when polled.
